intro: Pouzolzia integrifolia, commonly known as the smooth pouzolzia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Polygonaceae. It is a perennial shrub characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, ovate leaves that are typically smooth-edged. The plant produces clusters of greenish-white flowers, which are borne in dense, spike-like inflorescences. It is native to various regions in the Americas and thrives in moist, well-drained soils. Pouzolzia integrifolia is often found in woodland edges and stream banks, where it contributes to the ecological diversity of its habitat.
